Ikuti Ujian Bahasa Sunda, Para Calon Kades di Bandung Barat Kewalahan
01 Nov 2019, 12:47 by Cecep Wijaya Sari
NGAMPRAH, (PR).- Penguasaan bahasa Sunda menjadi salah satu materi uji kompetensi yang harus dikuasai ratusan calon kades di Kabupaten Bandung Barat. Uji kompetensi itu merupakan bagian dari seleksi tambahan bagi setiap desa yang memiliki lebih dari lima calon kades.
“Sesuai peraturan bupati, desa-desa yang memiliki lebih dari lima calon kades diberikan seleksi tambahan yang dilaksanakan di peguruan tinggi. Salah satunya, ada uji kompetensi mengenai penguasaan bahasa Indonesia dan bahasa Sunda,” kata Kepala Dinas Pemberdayaan Masyarakat dan Desa Kabupaten Bandung Barat, Wandiana, Jumat 1 November 2019.
Dia mengatakan, seleksi tambahan tersebut diikuti 315 calon kades dari 43 desa di Universitas Jenderal Ahmad Yani, Cimahi pada Kamis 31 Oktober 2019.
Perguruan tinggi tersebut ditunjuk pemerintah daerah karena dinilai kompeten menggelar tes bagi para calon kades.
Menurut Wandiana, penguasaan terhadap bahasa Sunda menjadi salah satu penilaian dari serangkaian tes yang diberikan. Untuk materi uji, dia menyerahkan sepenuhnya hal itu kepada perguruan tinggi yang menggelar tes.
“Secara materi dan teknis ujian, kami percayakan kepada para akademisi di Unjani. Kami tidak ada intervensi mengenai hal itu,” ujarnya.
Selain penguasaan bahasa Sunda, para kades juga diberikan tes mengenai kepemimpinan, pengetahuan umum, dan etika.
Dalam pelaksanaan seleksi tambahan, para peserta harus menyelesaikan 2 sesi tertulis dengan jumlah 50 soal yang harus diselesaikan dalam waktu 90 menit. Selanjutnya, peserta memasuki sesi wawancara dan kecakapan berbahasa Sunda.
Terkait kecakapan berbahasa Sunda, diakui oleh banyak peserta sangat sulit. Calon kades Nyalindung, Kecamatan Cipatat, Lia Yuliani Rosali kesulitan menerjemahkan bahasa Sunda ke dalam bahasa Indonesia.
“Kalau untuk tes tertulis tidak ada masalah, ketika menerjemahkan bahasa Sunda ke Bahasa Indonesia, itu sulit,” ujarnya.
Kesulitan serupa dialami Nanang Supriatna, Calon kades Karyamukti, Kecamatan Cililin. Meski setiap hari menggunakan bahasa Sunda, saat ujian, dia kesulitan melakukan penerjemahan ke dalam bahasa Indonesia.
Pilkades serentak di Kabupaten Bandung Barat digelar di 112 desa dari 16 kecamatan pada 24 November 2019. Jumlah pendaftar calon kades tahun ini membeludak, mencapai 553 orang.
Sementara itu, data para calon pemilih saat ini masih dalam bentuk daftar pemilih sementara di 112 desa yang berjumlah 856.288 orang. Penetapan daftar pemilih tetap akan dilakukan pada 10-12 November 2019.***

Following the Sundanese Language Test, Candidates for Village Heads in West Bandung were overwhelmed
01 Nov 2019, 12:47 by Cecep Wijaya Sari
NGAMPRAH, (PR) .- The mastery of Sundanese is one of the competency test materials that must be mastered by hundreds of village head candidates in West Bandung Regency. The competency test is part of additional selection for each village that has more than five village head candidates.
"In accordance with regent regulations, villages that have more than five village head candidates are given additional selection which is carried out in tertiary institutions. One of them, there is a competency test on the mastery of Indonesian and Sundanese, "said the Head of the Community and Village Empowerment Office of West Bandung Regency, Wandiana, Friday 1 November 2019.
He said, the additional selection was followed by 315 village head candidates from 43 villages at Jenderal Ahmad Yani University, Cimahi on Thursday 31 October 2019.
The university was appointed by the regional government because it was considered competent in holding tests for the village head candidates.
According to Wandiana, mastery of the Sundanese language was one of the evaluations of a series of tests given. For the test material, he gave it entirely to the university which held the test.
"The material and technical exams, we entrust to academics at Unjani. We have no intervention on this matter, "he said.
In addition to mastering Sundanese, the village heads were also given tests on leadership, general knowledge, and ethics.
In carrying out additional selection, participants must complete 2 written sessions with a total of 50 questions that must be completed within 90 minutes. Next, participants enter the Sundanese interview and proficiency session.
Regarding Sundanese language proficiency, it was recognized by many participants as very difficult. Prospective village head of Nyalindung, Cipatat District, Lia Yuliani Rosali has difficulty translating Sundanese into Indonesian.
"If there is no problem for written tests, translating Sundanese into Indonesian is difficult," he said.
A similar difficulty was experienced by Nanang Supriatna, prospective head of village Karyamukti, District Cililin. Although he uses Sundanese every day, during exams, he has difficulty translating into Indonesian.
Simultaneous Pilkades in West Bandung Regency was held in 112 villages from 16 sub-districts on November 24, 2019. The number of registrants candidates for village heads this year has risen, reaching 553 people.
Meanwhile, the data of prospective voters is currently in the form of a provisional voter register in 112 villages totaling 856,288 people. Determination of the permanent voter list will be carried out on 10-12 November 2019. ***
